Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Panel's decision to deny refugee status based on lack of corroborating evidence is reasonable under IRPA
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed persecution due to forced marriage and inter-faith relationships in Liberia; Panel found testimony credible but lacking documentation; country reports did not indicate forced marriages in Liberia
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Panel's denial of refugee status
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to forced marriage and inter-faith relationship
Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA; person in need of protection facing risk of torture or cruel treatment
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony, availability of corroborating evidence, country condition reports
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review application challenging administrative decision
Credibility_Assessment: Testimony found credible but undermined by lack of supporting documentation
Evidence_Used: Applicant's testimony, country condition reports on Liberia, Nigeria, and Ghana
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on Convention refugee and person in need of protection
Application_Basis: Alleged risk of forced marriage and persecution due to inter-faith relationship in Liberia
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of documentation regarding forced marriages in Liberia
Governing_Rule: Under IRPA, a Convention refugee must have a well-founded fear of persecution for specific reasons
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Absence of corroborating evidence or documentation on forced marriages in Liberia
Harm_Assessment: Risk of forced marriage and inter-faith persecution upon return to Liberia
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status due to forced marriage and inter-faith relationship issues in Liberia
Evidence_Handling: Panel considered testimony credible but required objective corroboration
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; applicant failed to meet burden under IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Lack of documentary support for claim despite credible testimony
Legal_Provision: IRPA sections relating to refugee protection and person in need of protection
Evidence_Assessment: Country condition reports did not support prevalence of forced marriages in Liberia
Decision_Rationale: Lack of corroborating evidence justified negative credibility inference; decision reasonable under standard of review
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient objective evidence to support claim despite credible narrative
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard in judicial review of administrative decisions
